oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Order from Confederate General Braxton Bragg outlining the duties of the Provost Marshal, including suppression of marauding, depredations, brawls, disturbances, drunkenness, and gambling; and the regulation of hotels, taverns, and markets. It spells out authorities issued to the Provost Marshal for investigations, arrests, and punishments.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General orders are published directives issued by a commander, binding upon all personnel under his command. They affect policies or procedures unique to a unit's situation not addressed by service regulations. General orders have the force of law within the unit issuing them. Provost Marshals serve as military police within the jurisdiction they serve.
